title: Vayne is not a template upon which you should design new ADCs
body:
> To start things off, let’s talk about a new champ we have in the works. Looking back at the last few marksmen released, we discovered something that’s been null from our roster for a long time: a super high-risk, high-reward marksman, in the vein of well… Vayne.

Please don't. Vayne's an archaic ball of stats champion with little to no interactivity. Her counterplay boils down to essentially 'CC lock her until she dies' which is the worst and most frustrating feeling in the world. She's safe, mobile, self-sufficient, and hits like a fucking truck. When she's bad she gets bullied into uselessness. When she's good she's the single most unfun and infuriating champ in the game to face.

Self-sufficient 'hunter' style ADCs have always been balancing nightmares - Lucian, Twitch, Quinn, Vayne, etc. Getting a Void ADC is nice (even though a support would have been better to complete the team comp), getting a Void ADC based off of Vayne's 'feast or famine past twenty minutes I win now' design is not. Vayne is terrible, terrible design that has been kept alive for years because Riot doesn't want to confront her large, loud, and entitled playerbase. Please do not design ADCs based off of her, her kit, her playstyle, or whatever her fantasy is supposed to be. 

Besides, the entire marksmen class is low risk, maximum reward at all times anyway. I don't see how this new ADC is gonna break that rule with this god-awful meta we've had for the last two seasons.

replies.body: High risk high reward champions are always a nightmare to balance, because once you learn the champion well (e.g. one-tricks) the risk is significantly lower, and you're left with a broken champion that feels cheap and unfun to play against.

{{champion:268}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:157}} have all had this problem in the past or currently. Probably a few others I'm missing.
Imo champions like Azir Yasuo fully deservwe to have more strength than Garen/Master YI/Annie . Skill level should *somewhat* determine power.

That's true, but a champion's only weakness shouldn't be their skill cap, or something they can mitigate through their own kit (Yasuo needing to hit tornado but can just EQ you, Zoe being able to E point blank, etc.). That makes it so that they don't actually have a true weakness.

I've said since day 1 that Zoe's E should have a minimum travel distance before effect.  

Would instantly fix her, or at least make her less cancerous to the point of being tolerable.

> [{quoted}](name=Captain Tea,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-01-31T21:43:04.959+0000)
>
> High risk high reward champions are always a nightmare to balance, because once you learn the champion well (e.g. one-tricks) the risk is significantly lower, and you're left with a broken champion that feels cheap and unfun to play against.

{{champion:13}} been reworked 12 billion times still has this same problem lul meanwhile 12 billion champs need VGUs and updates.
My 1st thought.  High risk high reward based off Vayne. Where the risk then?
How about you actually play Vayne first, then you can get back on how risky Vayne is
to be honest vayne is not as risky as she should be. Especially in the current meta with 3 tanks and a support protecting her. At the moment she is basically a short range kogmaw with kiting tools

So if Vayne has an entire team dedicated to protecting her with peel and shields, she's too safe.

Now I don't know about you, but to me, that doesn't sound like a Vayne problem. Unless Vayne has suddenly become a conglomerate of 4 people.

I'm not saying that the front line is the reason for her being safe, it accentuates it. The thing is I wouldn't call 50 less range than other adc's in trade for tons of kiting tools (knockback, stun, stealth, dash) high risk.

There is a difference between range, and effective range.

Effective range is the distance someone can do damage from. So champions like Sivir and Lucian, even though they have a lower auto range, have a higher effective range due to their spells (Lucian Q and ult, Sivir boomerang toss and ricochet).

Vayne has 550 range, yes. But she also has 550 *effective* range. Every single thing she does is from the same exact point, and there's no way to effect anything outside of that.

That's what is meant by her being low range. In order to do anything, she has to go in. She can't stand back and poke or hide behind her front line to get her damage off. If she wants to hit something, she has to go in and hit it.

> [{quoted}](name=The Wolf King,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-31T22:46:58.286+0000)
>
> There is a difference between range, and effective range.
> 
> Effective range is the distance someone can do damage from. So champions like Sivir and Lucian, even though they have a lower auto range, have a higher effective range due to their spells (Lucian Q and ult, Sivir boomerang toss and ricochet).
> 
> Vayne has 550 range, yes. But she also has 550 *effective* range. Every single thing she does is from the same exact point, and there's no way to effect anything outside of that.
> 
> That's what is meant by her being low range. In order to do anything, she has to go in. She can't stand back and poke or hide behind her front line to get her damage off. If she wants to hit something, she has to go in and hit it.

and nobody cares since vayne is played more like an assassin anyway. and you will have to go in aa range at some point otherwise you are complete useless as an adc, but in comparison to champs like varus, ashe, sivir who have one spell they can use once to help them out in teamfights vayne can reposition herself constantly, while being invisible half the time on top of her condemn. So yeah she has to commit to a fight more than others but that is hardly a thing if u get every tool imaginable to deal with practically every situation ever.

> [{quoted}](name=The Wolf King,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-01-31T21:47:17.198+0000)
>
> How about you actually play Vayne first, then you can get back on how risky Vayne is

Sorry  I went invisible and condemned your post into a wall.  
  She might be weak vs other marksmen. So she might be weak too maybe 14 other champions in the game.  She's designed to statcheck everyone late game.  And has zero meaningful weakness or counterplay
How about people play vayne first to see if there is a risk or not?

> [{quoted}](name=I am Rubick Sama,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-01-31T21:52:08.400+0000)
>
> How about people play vayne first to see if there is a risk or not?

remove her "you outplayed me and got on top of me, but youre melee, so fuck you" - button that is her e and then we can talk about risk.

the only significant risk in playing her is against other marksmen during the early game, or against champions with ranged, direct target cc.

and do the same to tristanas r while youre at it.

Oh no, champions have self peel it's {{champion:101}} not {{champion:99}} like {{champion:134}} there {{champion:12}} aren't {{champion:9}} any {{champion:57}} other {{champion:412}} champions {{champion:163}} with {{champion:105}} the {{champion:92}}  ability {{champion:114}} to {{champion:117}} do {{champion:13}} that{{champion:161}}
ADCs should have the worst self peel, if they even have any.

Sure, if you want to gut the entire class. Either that or you tie supports to ADCs even more while giving them more damage to make up for the fact that they die instantly if someone takes 2 steps away from them.
If you want them to have self peel, let alone good self peel, then you'll have to redo the entire ADC paradigm.

And why? So they match perfectly with how weak you think they deserve to be?

If that's the case, then mages don't get self peel either. I mean, they are a damage class. If you get to them, they should just die right away. That seems fair, don't you think?

If you haven't noticed, most ADCs have some form of self peel or escape ability. Even the ones who don't have one outright have something else to help them (MF slow and super high MS, and Sivir has her spell shield and ult). In fact, nearly every champion in the game has something to help them out.

Because playing a champion that dies the second your allies decided to do fuck all else is not fun or good game design.

Why? Because the class with the highest damage in the game, should not be completely self sufficient.

>If you haven't noticed, most ADCs have some form of self peel or escape ability. Even the ones who don't have one outright have something else to help them (MF slow and super high MS, and Sivir has her spell shield and ult). In fact, nearly every champion in the game has something to help them out.

Yes, the worst self peel out of all classes (in most scenarios). Jhin has a piddly and easily avoidable root, MF has a slow, Ashe's ult is weakest point blank, etc. If an ADC has self peel, it should either be weak self peel, or ultimate gated. Unlike Vayne's which is a basic spell and knock back with upside for hitting a wall.

>Because playing a champion that dies the second your allies decided to do fuck all else is not fun or good game design.

An ADC's range is their defense. But you know what else isn't good design? Again, it's letting the highest damage class be adequately self sufficient. If you want them to have strong self peel, their damage needs to go down. A lot.

> [{quoted}](name=NineTailedMystic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=00020000000000010000000000000001,timestamp=2018-01-31T23:43:59.840+0000)
>
> Why? Because the class with the highest damage in the game, should not be completely self sufficient.
> 
> Yes, the worst self peel out of all classes (in most scenarios). Jhin has a piddly and easily avoidable root, MF has a slow, Ashe's ult is weakest point blank, etc. If an ADC has self peel, it should either be weak self peel, or ultimate gated. Unlike Vayne's which is a basic spell and knock back with upside for hitting a wall.
> 
> An ADC's range is their defense. But you know what else isn't good design? Again, it's letting the highest damage class be adequately self sufficient. If you want them to have strong self peel, their damage needs to go down. A lot.

100% True, every word. You cannot have your cake and eat it to.

Then remove any form of CC, including slows, from every champion that builds primarily damage.

Mages, Assassins, juggernauts.

Hell, make it so that those abilities get disabled as soon as you hit an AD/AP threshold.

After all, "You cannot have your cake and eat it too"

> [{quoted}](name=The Wolf King,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=0002000000000001000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-02-01T00:23:19.136+0000)
>
> Then remove any form of CC, including slows, from every champion that builds primarily damage.
> 
> Mages, Assassins, juggernauts.
> 
> Hell, make it so that those abilities get disabled as soon as you hit an AD/AP threshold.
> 
> After all, "You cannot have your cake and eat it too"

That is a damn strawman and you know it.

Is it?

Why then is it ok for *only* ADCs to lose their self reliance?

You're extremely and obviously biased, and your reading comprehension has thus far been vastly sub par.  I'm not sure with all the repeated and varied expressions, arguments and data people have already posted, that saying it again in the 11th or 12 different way will actually help you understand what you are clearly trying not to understand, and are simply straw-maning every single person you respond to, in apparent obliviousness to your own active ignorance. 

Let me ask you a question instead.

If you could pick the highest damage class, with the least requirements, undogable, manaless attacks that have functionally no down time, with your only limitation being your range, which is amongst the highest of all class; oh, and due to your fellow ADC mains bitching for 9 years, and you can win any 1 vs 1 regardless of class, while no longer having a single true counter class, let alone classes, while also getting your own *role* ***AND POSITION*** entitled to you by the sheer nature of how necessary you are to your team having a solid chance at winning, despite being but 1 of 12 subclasses, and there being only 5 roles and positions for you all to choose from--

I mean, there are 4 roles and positions for the other 11 sub classes to fight over, while the ADC gods are untouched and untouchable in their entrenched dominance.  What imperative or use is there, in relative terms then, to picking another sub class over your ADC?-- why wouldn't you pick that class over all others?  Like we've seen in bot lane, 100% of the time for both teams in competitive play since 2009. 

See the thing is, every other class need to rely on their ADC out damaging the other ADC so that someone on their team is still alive by the time the enemy team dies.  ADC are the ***ABSOLUTELY ONLY TRULY SELF SUFFICIENT CLASS IN THE GAME WHILE ALSO BEING THE #1 MOST IMPORTANT ROLE IN DECIDING THE OUT COME OF THE CAME***

That is what the problem is.


It is not, as your ludicrous straw-man attempts to imply, the case that a single other class or role is actually self sufficient and the ADCs are the ones losing something relative to everyone else.  The problem is that ADC have ***CLEAR AND DISTINCT, SYSTEMIC IMBALANCES IN THEIR FAVOR THAT NO, I REPEAT NO OTHER CLASS HAS SIMILAR ACCESS TO, TO ANY DEGREE***

> [{quoted}](name=NineTailedMystic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=00020000000000010000000000000001,timestamp=2018-01-31T23:43:59.840+0000)

Jhin has a piddly and easily avoidable root, MF has a slow, Ashe's ult is weakest point blank, etc. If an ADC has self peel, it should either be weak self peel, or ultimate gated. Unlike Vayne's which is a basic spell and knock back with upside for hitting a wall.

> An ADC's range is their defense. But you know what else isn't good design? Again, it's letting the highest damage class be adequately self sufficient. If you want them to have strong self peel, their damage needs to go down. A lot.

Can't believe people down voted this. Why should the class that can literally damage a team down with ridiculous sustained damage at range with undodgeale unmissable autos also be extremely self sufficient?

Its even better when vayne does true damage.
Oh i'll just build health stack-
_Oh wait_

The difference is, all of those have a drawback, whether it be they have to land their abilities in order to do damage, have a very expensive build, are incredibly squishy on top of being melee, or generally just don't have any damage. Some of those have to land an ability in order to be able to run, whereas someone like vayne, cait, or even luc just have to dash away (in this case, vayne being the prime offender)

Xerath comes online with {{item:3165}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3020}} : 7200 gold

Vayne: {{item:3031}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3006}} : 9700 gold. And if they have any kind of tank or strong poke, then you need lifesteal and a QSS, for a minimum of 2200 more gold.

Who's got the expensive build?

yes but that's an entire 3 items up and she outscales, and starts doing serious damage with just statikk and ie, especially if she gets one of these items first and begins snowballing with it. If you're really asking, Xerath has the much more expensive build.

> starts doing serious damage with just statikk and ie

No, no she does not.

The reason there is a different amount of items is to show the fallacy of "ADCs have the cheapest items". If you are any of the energized crit ADCs, you will not be doing damage (**UNLESS** you have gotten fed and have been able to purchase those at like 15 mins into the game! But that doesn't happen unless you severely messed up and fed the enemy to high heaven). Meanwhile, most mages come online mostly with just Morello, and start really pumping out damage with their second core item (be that a Ludens, Liandries, Void staff. Basically anything except Deathcap, because that item sucks, but unless your name is Veigar, you usually aren't building it then)

tf of course she does

every adc that builds those two items come immediately online and start chunking hard and target-agnostically.

all those that don't instead build guinsoos wits end and just shred whatever comes close.

Says the person who doesn't even play ADCs.

I'm not going around telling you what Tahm Kench can and can't do. Why are you doing the same for an entire *class* you don't play?

Tahm Kench hasn't had the whole game changed to benefit solely him and those who synergize with him at the expense of the rest of the roster, nor has he dominated the meta and warped game health for two seasons while escaping any meaningful nerfs. 

You don't play Vayne. By your logic, you shouldn't be commenting on this thread.

I think your example is pretty bad, First off lux doesnt really have self peel she has cc and kiting alistar is a tank not self peel maokai is a tank thresh is a tank taliyah is a mage not as much damage fizz is an assassin and uses his E to go in not peel riven is melee along with fiora so if they walk up they get one tapped ryze has a little shield and a crappy root and velkoz just has cc not self peel. Self peel would be more situational cc and wouldnt need to be comboed, If vayne Es it knocks them away if lux Qs she can technically peel herself but all of a sudden shes missing a huge part of her combo. If lux only aaed then it would be considered self peel because she doesnt need it to do damage it would be mainly for stopping people from getting on her.
What do you count as self peel if not CC? Know anything else that peels people off?

I feel as though the examples were god awful.....It makes no sense in any regard to talk about tanks self peeling...I guess full ap maokai right???? Thunder cow alistar right???? I think if you can do without it and the only purpose of it is to stop people from getting on you then its self peel.Vayne doesnt need her E she can use her R Q to dash around her E peels people off her when she can do well without it. The amount of damage related also matters, Taliyahs self peel is more of a play making move and its one of her core damaging abilities otherwise she would have one damaging ability her Q....
You don't think Trist's R isn't a fuk u button vs ranged?

> [{quoted}](name=AirKingNeo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=000200000002,timestamp=2018-02-01T00:49:21.319+0000)

this is all i'm asking

**GOING IN 550 RANGE AND GETTING ONESHOT FROM A MAGE IS HIGH RISK HIGH REWARD**

is this understandable if written like this my dear garen main?
Oh yeah it’s super fun being a mage trying to hit a skillshot on an invisible tumbling ADC chunking you for a third of your health every auto

it is

wanna bet how fun it is compared to playing against kench negating any non-instant spells and any melee champions?

if you play vayne, i just dare you, i dare you to get in 550 range of cass, malz, ryze, azir, viktor

*thread is about Vayne*

*rubick brings up and bitches about Tahm Kench anyway because I main him*

Seems about right

well to be fair. Vayne is cancer and should not be used as the base for anything. But Neither should Kench. He is An oppressive champ in the solo lane and damn right annoying as a support when he straight up eats the marksmen and runs away with them after you finally managed to catch them.
If Vayne is getting one shot, then she's not using her outplay tools correctly, unless it's point and click CC.

> [{quoted}](name=I am Rubick Sama,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2018-01-31T22:32:12.221+0000)
>
> play her once instead of garen
> 
> then come back 
> this is all i'm asking
> 
> **GOING IN 550 RANGE AND GETTING ONESHOT FROM A MAGE IS HIGH RISK HIGH REWARD**
> 
> is this understandable if written like this my dear garen main?

If that's your definition of high risk, then literally everybody who isn't Ezreal, Jhin, or Caitlyn is high risk, including every melee champion that doesn't build tanky. That's a poor definition of high risk.

If you only have risk against other longer range champions, but do not have ***ANY RISK AT ALL*** from pure melees, then for a good chunk of the roster, ***YOU HAVE NO COUNTERPLAY***  It's really that fucking simple. 

And immobile melees can't beat her due to her 3 AA passives, but they also can't hit her due to her 50% up time stealth in a fight that can last for up to 24 seconds of +90 ms + 40 AD and 12 seconds of invisibility that cannot be revealed. 

Oh, and that utterly ridiculous +90 ms steroid she has passively?  That keeps them from ever escaping, so they get in range of her once, and then they are condemn stunned, or just chased down dying to 4 passive effects and being right mouse buttoned once, with no agency nor way to fight back is fucking hell.

> [{quoted}](name=I am Rubick Sama,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sbxApFNw,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2018-01-31T22:32:12.221+0000)

but how does this take more risk than playing most other squishy champions?

in that sense its still less risky playing vayne vs. playing yi or fiora. shes just as mobile, and they dont even have that luxurity of 550 range.
